ds_strings_archive.string: Need HM-Cut!
Need HM-Rock Smash!
Need HM-Waterfall!
Need HM-Rock Climb!

[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
Welcome! This is the Oreburgh Pokémon Gym! I'm Roark,
the Gym Leader! I'm but one Trainer who decided to walk
proudly with Rock-type Pokémon! As the Gym Leader, I
need to see your potential as a Trainer. And, I'll need to
see the toughness of the Pokémon that battle with you!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8632] / +50%[$12948] / +75%[$15106] / +100%[$17264]
 
In this region of Sinnoh, there are seven other Gym Leaders.
I should warn you--they're a lot tougher than I am!

[$8736] / +50%[$13104] / +75%[$15288] / +100%[$17472]
 
You kept me waiting! I'm Eterna's Gym Leader, Gardenia,
the Grass-type master! When I first saw you, I was convinced
you'd find your way to me. My hunch was right on the money.
You have a winning aura about you. So, anyway, this will be fun.
Let's have our battle!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8736] / +50%[$13104] / +75%[$15288] / +100%[$17472]
 
Yup! If there's one thing I can tell about you, it's this! You and
your Pokémon are gonna get even tougher, and I mean seriously!

[$8840] / +50%[$13260] / +75%[$15470] / +100%[$17680]
 
Ohohoho!! Finally, you have arrived!
Since I came to this country, always I try to learn new things.
They hold Contests in this city? I say to myself, enfin, I will excel.
That is why I dress this way. C'est une performance!
Also, I study Pokémon very much. I have come to be Gym Leader.
And, uh, so it shall be that you challenge me.
But I shall win. That is what a Gym Leader does, non?
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8840] / +50%[$13260] / +75%[$15470] / +100%[$17680]
 
Three Gym Badges... But you must not forget this.
There are many other Trainers. Strong Trainers, too.
There are many more in Sinnoh. Have patience!
You must become stronger, one at a time.

[$8944] / +50%[$13416] / +75%[$15652] / +100%[$17888]
 
Hello. I'm pleased to meet you. I'm Maylene, and I'm
the Gym Leader. I don't really know what it means to be
strong, or how I got to be the Gym Leader. But I will do the
best I can as the Gym Leader. I take battling very seriously.
Whenever you're ready!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$8944] / +50%[$13416] / +75%[$15652] / +100%[$17888]
 
Gee, I'm hungry... Oh, sorry, it's nothing. I didn't say anything.
{00}, I can't explain what it means to be strong.
I don't know how much effort goes into being strong... But
being with Pokémon lets us keep making the effort, doesn't it?

[$9048] / +50%[$13572] / +75%[$15834] / +100%[$18096]
 
Welcome! I don't get challenged very often!
The glory you are now beholding is the Pastoria Gym Leader!
That's right, I'm Crasher Wake! My Pokémon were toughened
up by stormy white waters! They'll take everything you can
throw at them and then pull you under! Victory will be ours!
Come on, let's get it done!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9048] / +50%[$13572] / +75%[$15834] / +100%[$18096]
 
The styles of battling and winning are as widely varied as
Trainers are. Do you want to know how I battle? I battle so
I can say I had fun at the end, whether I win or lose!

[$9152] / +50%[$13728] / +75%[$16016] / +100%[$18304]
 
Ah! That's Oreburgh's Gym Badge! I see, I see! You've defeated
my son. But that's no surprise. He still has much to learn.
In place of my son Roark, I, Byron, will take your challenge!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9152] / +50%[$13728] / +75%[$16016] / +100%[$18304]
 
Gwahahahaha! The Sinnoh region is vast! Tough Trainers like you
and {01} crop up constantly to challenge the old guard! With
more young Trainers like my son and you two taking charge, the
future of Pokémon is bright! But I'm not stepping aside just yet!
I merely need to rededicate myself to training on Iron Island.

[$9256] / +50%[$13884] / +75%[$16198] / +100%[$18512]
 
You want to challenge Candice? Sure thing! I was waiting for
someone tough! But I should tell you, I'm tough because I know
how to focus. Pokémon, fashion, romance... It's all about focus!
I'll show you just what I mean. Get ready to lose!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9256] / +50%[$13884] / +75%[$16198] / +100%[$18512]
 
Do you think I should try to act more like an Ice-type Gym Leader?
Like, do you think I should be more cool and distant?
That sort of thing I have trouble with.

[$9360] / +50%[$14040] / +75%[$16380] / +100%[$18720]
 
...All right, challenger. It's not often, but some Trainers
manage to come and challenge me. But they've all been boring
battles. I didn't break a sweat beating them....Sigh... I'm Volkner,
the Gym Leader. They say I'm the top Gym Leader in Sinnoh, but...
Anyway, I guess we'd better get this done. I hope you're the
Trainer who'll make me remember how fun it is to battle!
\n\n

[ON COOLDOWN / 18 Hours]
[$9360] / +50%[$14040] / +75%[$16380] / +100%[$18720]
 
Your next step is the Pokémon League challenge. It's time for
you to cross the sea and win your way through the gauntlet that
is Victory Road. Demonstrate to the Pokémon League your
mastery of your team. Against you, even the Elite Four will be
pushed to fend off your challenge!
You will be facing the Elite Four of the Pokémon League. If you\ncan't beat all four of them in a row, you have to start from the\nfirst one again.
Very well! Trainer, you've indeed collected all the Gym\nBadges of Sinnoh! Demonstrate the power that brought you\nhere and go for glory!

Hello! Welcome to the Pokémon League! I'm Aaron of the Elite
Four. It's good to meet you. Oh, I should explain, I'm a huge fan of
bug Pokémon. Bug Pokémon are nasty-mean, and yet they're
beautiful, too... Would you like to know why I take on challengers
here? It's because I want to become perfect, just like my bug
Pokémon! OK! Let me take you on!
\n\n

I lost with the most beautiful and toughest of the bug Pokémon...
We lost because I wasn't good enough... That's it! Back to training
camp! Let's hear it for me! No... That was wrong... Anyway...
Go on to the next room! Three Trainers are waiting for you.
They're all tougher than me.
Go on, go to the next room. I'm going to become a top-level\nTrainer who can't be outclassed with my beautiful and tough\nbug Pokémon!

Well, well. You're quite the adorable Trainer, but you've also got
a spine. Ahaha! I'm Bertha. I have a preference for Ground-type
Pokémon. Well, would you show this old lady how much
you've learned?
\n\n
You're quite something, youngster. I like how you and your\nPokémon earned the win by working as one. That's what makes\nyou so strong. Ahahaha! I think that you can go as far as you want.
The Trainer in the next room is a much more formidable\nopponent. You really must have your wits about you.\nHowever, I think you can go as far as you desire. Ahahaha!

I was waiting for you, challenger!
Flint, the master of the Fire type, is up next! Battles
are clashes of the burning spirit of Pokémon. Battles aren't
about appearances or what's weak or strong. It all comes
down to whether the combatants can burn hot or not.
\n\n
... ...\n...Whew...\n...Burnt right down to cinders...
... ... ...Keep going... I know your spirit burns hot.\nYour whole team does.

Ah, you timed your arrival well. I've just finished reading
a book, you see. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Lucian.
I am a user of the Psychic type. I must say, you've already
proven yourself to be outstanding by coming this far. They
say I am the toughest of the Elite Four. I'm afraid I will have
to go all out against you to live up to that reputation.
\n\n

Congratulations. You've now beaten the Elite Four. However,
that doesn't mean you're done with the Pokémon League.
There remains the Champion. I should warn you--the Champion
is far stronger than the Elite Four. Now, go on. Step through the
doorway to your final battle.
I'll be reading books until the next challenger arrives.\nThat will calm my nerves, so that I may deal with all situations\nwithout panicking.

Cynthia: One look at you tells me many things about you.
Together, you and your Pokémon overcame all the challenges you
faced, however difficult. It means that you've triumphed over
any personal weaknesses, too. The power you learned... I can feel
it from you. That's enough talking. Let's get on with why you're
here. I, Cynthia, accept your challenge as the Pokémon League
Champion! There won't be any letup from me!
\n\n

Cynthia: That was excellent. Truly, an outstanding battle. You
gave the support your Pokémon needed to maximize their power.
And you guided them with certainty to secure victory. You have
both passion and calculating coolness. Together, you and your
Pokémon can overcome any challenge that may come your way.
Those are the impressions I got from our battle. I'm glad I got to
take part in the crowning of Sinnoh's new Champion!
Come with me. We'll take the lift.\n\n
Cynthia: The room ahead is the Hall of Fame...\n\n
Rowan: {00}! Your last battle was splendid!\n\n
Cynthia: Oh, hello, Professor Rowan.\n\n

Rowan: Hm! A child I enlisted for my Pokédex project has come
this far... It's only natural that I come and witness the child's
crowning glory. {00}! I shouldn't call you
a child anymore. You've grown into a real Champion!

Cynthia: Professor, you still enjoy the enthusiasm kids
bring to your research, don't you?
{00}, step this way, please.\n\n
Professor Rowan, please join us.\n\n
Rowan: It's been a long while since I last entered this room...\n\n

Cynthia: If your last time here was when I became Champion, then yes,
that would be quite a long time ago.

Rowan: No matter how many times I come here, I always
find myself standing up straighter than usual.

Cynthia: It's a natural reaction, Professor. This room is a
legacy to the hopes, dreams, and struggles of Pokémon
and their Trainers to excel.
Cynthia: {00}, welcome to the Hall of Fame.\n\n

Your names will be recorded for posterity here.
What you are leaving are the memories of your adventure
so far. It's time to record your names. You and your Pokémon.
Remember, your Pokémon are partners that grew with you
through many challenging battles. This machine will make a
permanent record of your achievement.

Only the chosen may enter the Snowpoint Temple.
I'm sorry, but you will have to leave.
 
[You must complete the Regional Seen dex for Sinnoh,
once you have talk to Professor Rowan and return here.]
(No Legendary or Mythical required for completion)

Only the chosen may enter the Snowpoint Temple.
I'm sorry, but you will have to leave.
 
[You must complete the Regional Seen dex for Sinnoh,
once you have talk to Professor Rowan and return here.]
(No Legendary or Mythical required for completion)

Let me size you up... You'll meet many, many Pokémon.
That's what you should be thinking.
Eventually, the world will appear bigger to you!
 
[You must complete the Regional Seen dex for Sinnoh,
once you have talk to Professor Rowan and return here.]
(No Legendary or Mythical required for completion)
I'm the Day-Care Lady. We can raise Pokémon for you.\nWould you like us to raise your Pokémon?
Which Pokémon should we raise for you?\n\n

Fine, we'll raise your {00} for a while.
Come back for it later.
We can raise two of your Pokémon.\nWould you like us to raise another?
Oh, fine, then. Come again.
Do you want to take back the other one, too?
Ah, it's you! Good to see you. Now, about your Pokémon...\n\n

By level, your {00} has
grown by about {01}.
Your Pokémon team is full.\nMake room, then come see me.
Which Pokémon will you take back?
If you want your {00} back,\nit will cost ${01}.
Excellent! Here's your Pokémon.\n\n

{01} took {00} back
from the Day-Care Lady.
Oh? But you only have one Pokémon with you.\nYou can't go off without a Pokémon.\nCome back another time.
If you leave me that Pokémon, what are you gonna battle with?\nCome back another time.
Very good. Come again.
Welcome to the Great Marsh, the home of Pastoria's\nSafari Game! All you can catch for just $500!\nWould you like to play a Safari Game?
That will be $500, please.\n\n
Here are your Safari Balls.\n\n
{00} received 30 Safari Balls.\n\n

We'll let you know when your game is over.
Until then, enjoy yourself, please!
Off you go on your wild excursion!

OK. I'll relieve you of your remaining Safari Balls.
Thank you for playing. We hope to see you again.
You still have time left.\nAre you sure you want to exit the Great Marsh?

Each Area in the Marsh has different Pokémon depending
on the day. Here is the list of areas and there rotations!

Area 1
 
-Sunday: Skorupi
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Carnivine
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Skorupi
-Saturday: Skorupi

Area 2
 
-Sunday: Skorupi
-Monday: Skorupi
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Carnivine
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Skorupi

Area 3
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Skorupi
-Tuesday: Skorupi
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Carnivine
-Saturday: Croagunk

Area 4
 
-Sunday: Carnivine
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Skorupi
-Wednesday: Skorupi
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Carnivine

Area 5
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Carnivine
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Skorupi
-Thursday: Skorupi
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Croagunk

Area 6
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Carnivine
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Skorupi
-Friday: Skorupi
-Saturday: Croagunk

Great Marsh Area 1
 
-Sunday: Skorupi
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Carnivine
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Skorupi
-Saturday: Skorupi

Great Marsh Area 2
 
-Sunday: Skorupi
-Monday: Skorupi
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Carnivine
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Skorupi

Great Marsh Area 3
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Skorupi
-Tuesday: Skorupi
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Carnivine
-Saturday: Croagunk

Great Marsh Area 4
 
-Sunday: Carnivine
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Skorupi
-Wednesday: Skorupi
-Thursday: Croagunk
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Carnivine

Great Marsh Area 5
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Carnivine
-Tuesday: Croagunk
-Wednesday: Skorupi
-Thursday: Skorupi
-Friday: Croagunk
-Saturday: Croagunk

Great Marsh Area 6
 
-Sunday: Croagunk
-Monday: Croagunk
-Tuesday: Carnivine
-Wednesday: Croagunk
-Thursday: Skorupi
-Friday: Skorupi
-Saturday: Croagunk
Where would you like to go?
{00} didn't board the Quick Tram.
Ding-dong! Time's up!\nYour Safari Game is over.
Ding-dong! You've run out of Safari Balls.\nYour Safari Game is over.

I let my bird Pokémon carry me to wherever.
And so, here I am!
\n\n
I was born in the Hoenn region.\nI've only just recently flown here.\n

In the embrace of Mother Nature,
people and Pokémon grow strong!
\n\n
It doesn't matter where they grow. Pokémon can be\nmade tougher anywhere if you set your mind to it.\n

Right after this, you will send out your
Pokémon to do battle!
\n\n

What will you do after this?
Why don't you decide for yourself?
It would be much more fun that way!

We go on patrol to make sure there's nothing strange
going on. And occasionally, we battle!
\n\n

Using the Pokémon ability Pickup for gathering dropped items
is a good thing. I think it's ecological, even. I am cleaning up
the environment!

There is something missing in the way I battle...
I've come here to find it.
\n\n
Battling you was an eye-opener.\nI learned something very important in that short time.\n

I've pumped up my gang till they can't get pumped no more.
They're going to school your Pokémon!
\n\n
I fed my gang Protein, Carbos...\nYou name it, I pumped 'em full of it.\n
Worthy opponents... The search for them drives me to travel far.\n\n
\n\n
How much you believe in your Pokémon...\nThat's a critical factor in how a battle will turn out.\n

Hmm!
{00} is really good!

Wouldn't you agree?

Hmm!
We're of identical minds!

Hmm!
Take this {00}!
Try fishing wherever there is a body of water.\nOh, incidentally, do you need me to explain how to use that fishing rod?
You don't like to fish?
First, you face any body of water, then you use your fishing rod.\nThen you have to get a nibble, it takes patience!
When you're fishing for Pokémon, the first hurdle is getting a bite.\nWhen you start to reel that Pokémon in, you've got to battle it.\nSo, fishing gives you twice the fun!
Hmm! A Super Rod is really good!\nWouldn't you agree?

Hmm! We're of identical minds! Hmm!
Take this {00}!
Wherever there's water, try your luck at fishing.
Don't you like to fish?
What's that? Any advice for fishing?\nWell, I'll tell you. It's all about the rod and technique!

I've got the urge to battle with you.
Hope you're willing to oblige!
\n\n
So long as my partner's alongside me,\nI'm willing to take on the world!\n

We've grown strong together in nature and in the concrete
jungle. We make everywhere we go our playground!
\n\n
Look around you at this wildly contorted terrain. It's no wonder\nthat Pokémon would xgrow tough in a place like this.\n

Wake: Oh, if it isn't {00}!
It's been a while! You've grown so tough that you're training out
here now... Everyone keeps getting tougher and tougher... And,
in doing that, they develop closer bonds with their Pokémon...

{01}: That's my master!
Those are words of wisdom!

Wake: What? Are you still having trouble understanding?
I don't for a second ever recall accepting you as an apprentice!
I mean, if it's wrestling moves, I can show you all you like, but...

{01}: Awww, master, don't be that way!
You've got to get me into that club in the Survival Area!

Wake: ...How'd I get involved in this...?
So, anyway, {00}. You're going to Stark Mountain?
Even the wild Pokémon there are very, very tough... If your
Pokémon aren't well trained, they'll have a miserable time...
Then again, that kind of challenge is an exciting prospect...
But no matter what, you'd better be fully prepared!
I've got to get ready for another tournament. Farewell!

{01}: You know, I think I got a little tougher again.
That's why I'm off to the Battle Frontier so I can make some challenges!
Master! Wait for me!\n\n
Oh, dear, are your Pokémon feeling tired?\nYou should rest up. Yes, good idea! Rest up here!
Yes, yes, that's right. Get some well-earned rest.\n\n
Is that right? You're sure now? I'm only concerned for your sake.\nNo need to worry about putting me out!
Oh, you're still looking tired. You're still needing rest, are you?\nYou should rest up again. Yes, good idea! Rest up here!

Buck: Yo, if it isn't {00}!
Out training right away, are you?
So, uh, since you're training anyway, can you do me a favor?
I'd like you to patrol Stark Mountain for me.

I'll keep asking the same thing over and
over until you say “Yes!”

Buck: Up past here, there's this volcano. It's Stark Mountain.
Deep inside it is this special rock called the Magma Stone.
I can't explain it well, but it's really important.
It keeps a Pokémon asleep. But lately, I've been hearing rumors
about vandals in Stark Mountain. They say goons in space suits
are causing trouble there.

Huh? What, me? I was on my way to the Pokémon Center
because my Pokémon's low on HP. So, if you could get up to
Stark Mountain now, that'd be great. Thanks!
Buck: OK! You're in charge! Patrol Stark Mountain for me!\nDon't worry about me. Not even a little bit, OK?

The world is huge, and there are so many different Pokémon!
What kinds of Pokémon are with you?
Please, I want to have a look!
Wow, there are Pokémon that\nwonderful!\n
There is always something to like about any Pokémon.\nIt's so hard to decide which ones I should raise.\n

I have meditated under a waterfall to temper my spirit.
Allow me to demonstrate its strength!
\n\n
All that time under the waterfall...\nSeems I've caught a cold.\n
My Pokémon and I seek only victory!\n\n
\n\n
I failed my Pokémon! I wasn't prepared enough to lead it!\nI don't ever want my precious Pokémon to be humiliated again!\n

Grunt 1: This is it! Stark Mountain!
Now we need to get deep inside. Let's do this!

Grunt 2: Yeah, but... Can that old guy really take over?
Can he replace Master Cyrus?

Grunt 1: Yeah, I hear you... That elder Charon is a Commander,
but he can't replace Master Cyrus. ...Maybe this is a good time
for me to be done with this Team Galactic thing...
Stark Mountain Eruption Zone!

Mars: Hey! You! Tell us where Master Cyrus went.
Where were you after you disappeared at the Spear Pillar?
Huh? The Distortion World?! Where GIRATINA was?
You're not making any sense! Don't play that card with me!
Fine! You don't want to talk? I'll bash you and make you talk!
\n\n

Mars: My Pokémon let me down again! How am I supposed to
get information about our missing Master Cyrus?

Jupiter: ...Mars. You really are weak. Pitifully so.
You make me embarrassed to be a Commander like you. Fine.
I'll go up next. I want to know what became of Master Cyrus, too.
\n\n
Jupiter: ...How dare you!\n\n

Mars: OK! That's it for me! I'm going to look for Master Cyrus.
The Distortion World, was it called? I should go there, right?
I'm quits with Team Galactic. Jupiter, you can deal with it!

Jupiter: Following Mars's lead at anything irks me, but...
I'm quitting to do my own thing, too. Team Galactic's just no
fun without Master Cyrus around. So, old-timer, go ahead.
Do what you want with Team Galactic.

Mars: There you have it. We're going back to being ordinary girls.
You can mop up whichever way you want.

Jupiter: ...Says you. An “ordinary girl” you're not.
What should I do now? Is leaving on a journey the right idea?

Charon: Sigh... So impressionable and impetuous. What do they
see in Cyrus? Immature, overthinking buffoon. He goes through
the trouble of assembling Team Galactic for what?
Ultimately, he destroys his own creation for his ludicrous vision.
It's no thanks to him that I have to struggle with the pieces.

...But that's fine. The young can live with their dreams. I prefer
to remain firmly in reality. And for that, money is paramount.
You there, child. I'm not dealing with you. After all, the other
Galactic members who did all suffered consequences.
We'll be off to collect the Magma Stone. It's all for the money!

Buck: Hey, {00}, wait up!
So, what's going on? ...What?! Team Galactic's here?
Gotcha! Let's team up and go together.
{00} decided to go with Buck!
Buck: You won't regret teaming up!\nI'll keep your Pokémon healthy!
Buck: This is where I raised my Pokémon.\nI can't stand the thought of anyone making a mess of this place.\nEspecially not those weird Team Galactic goons!

Buck: There's no law that says I have to be tough or anything,\nbut losing isn't fair to my Pokémon. After all, they try so hard\nfor me. I think it's my responsibility as a Trainer to recognize their hard work.

Buck: My big brother's one of the Elite Four. So, of course
it's only normal that I'd be better than ordinary folks.
But that's not what I want. I want to be tough on my own terms.
It wouldn't be fair to the Pokémon that chose to be with me.
Buck: It might be cool being a Gym Leader or one of the Elite\nFour... But, then again, it sounds like it'd be a lot of hard work!
Buck: Team Galactic's here, right? Let's go together!\n\n

Buck: Whoa! Hold up! If you go back, you'll leave me all by my
lonesome here! Well, if you gotta go, you gotta go.
I'll stick around here for you.

Buck: Here we are! Team Galactic's inside, right?
This is it. No fooling around!

My Pokémon can destroy anything.
And you think you can win?!
\n\n
Even though my team could break bricks and shatter boulders,\nthey failed to dent your spirits!\n

With one mighty flap, my birds blow
away the embers of aggression!
\n\n
The HM Fly isn't useful inside caves. It's such a shame.\n
Dragons and a fiery mountain... It's a totally classic setup!\n\n
\n\n
My Pokémon seem to like it here a lot.\n
Hear the howl of my iron fists! Howdy! I'm crazy for karate!\n\n
\n\n
I love seeing people who love Pokémon more than anything!\n

I was born in Floaroma Town. I'm sure thrilled to be here.
It took a long time to get here. We're not going to lose again!
\n\n

You can level all you want, but that won't guarantee you any
wins. But we keep trying to get better. That's what makes us
Trainers.
I came here after winning my way through the Battle Tower!\n\n
\n\n
Train more at the Battle Tower... That's what I'll do.\n

Charon: ...Cyrus disappeared. Mars and Jupiter quit.
Saturn said he would look after what remains of Team Galactic.
But he won't join me. So foolish of him!
So very foolish of the rest of them! Throwing away Team Galactic!
After all the effort we took as a team to make it grow...
That power could have made us rich beyond imagination.
But, enough of that. The Magma Stone will be mine.
Buck: Hey, you! Team Galactic! What's going on here?!\n\n

Charon: Eh? What's this, then? Chased me here, have you?
I like seeing children try their best, but too bad for you-
you're too late. With this Magma Stone I will let awaken the
legendary HEATRAN! I will control the volcano's eruptions to
extort money by the millions! Fear me! For I am Charon!
The boss of the rebornTeam Galactic!
???: Go, go, go!\n\n
Charon: No! The Magma Stone! What?! What is going on?!\n\n
???: Excellent work, CROAGUNK!\n\n

Looker: Pah! Disguising myself as a boulder for
stakeout was not easy!

Now, old-timer, the International Police cordially requests your
cooperation. I am sure you have much to tell us about the new
Team Galactic. With Cyrus, Mars, and Jupiter gone,
you are all that is left.
Grunt 1: Hey! It's the International Police!\n\n

Grunt 2: Yeah! It's the International Police all right!
There's only one thing to be done!

Grunt 1: Run away!
Grunt 2: Run away!

Charon: Gah... What a mess... ...Uh, International Police?
What are you saying? I know nothing! A new Team Galactic?
Extorting with HEATRAN? Merely the blathering of this harmless
old man! All said in jest! Besides, among Team Galactic's
Commanders, I was the most junior...

Looker: You can tell us all about it. We have plenty of time.
Oh, no, no. No resisting arrest. You can't win three-on-one, no?
OK, Officers, over here, if you will.

Looker: He is an old man. This heat cannot be good for him.
Quickly, take him somewhere cool. Yes, the cooler will do!

Looker: {00}! And you, unfamiliar boy!
I wish to say something. First, it is too hot!
Let us exit this environment!

Looker: Whew! The air outside, it is delicious, yes! ...Gweh! Gah!
Geff! Bleah! I have inhaled the volcanic ash by the lungful!

Now, you two. This is what they were after. The Magma Stone.
Moving this is said to awaken the Pokémon HEATRAN. The old
tales say that its awakening, it will make Stark Mountain erupt.
...But I have moved it. It is here. Will this cause the eruption?!

Buck: Hey, don't sweat it, stranger. Give me that Magma Stone.
I'll go put it back for you.

Looker: That boy, he has quite the energy, yes?
{00}, I should tell you why I have arrived here.
After we parted at the Mt. Coronet, I investigated their hideout.
I uncovered Charon's plot, which led me to a stakeout of this
place. That Charon is now securely within our custody.
It is safe to say the Team Galactic is a threat no longer.
That being said, it looks like my work here is finally finished.

Buck: Hey, stranger! I put the Magma Stone where it belongs.
It'll be OK now. HEATRAN won't wake up. Probably.
But, hey, {00}! You're an amazing Trainer!
Swing by my place later. It's in the Survival Area.
Be seeing you, stranger, {00}! Bye-bye!

Looker: I, also, will take my leave.
“The more wonderful the meeting, the sadder the parting.”
That is a quote I have heard many years ago in a foreign land.
Its meaning... I understand it better now. Farewell,
{00}, my friend! Long may you cherish Pokémon!
